Collect water sample
Fill HALF of the vial with sample water.
Open one foil packet and add powder contents to vial.
Cap vial and shake rapidly for 5 seconds. Remove cap.
Dip a strip into sample and remove immediately.
Dip a strip in the sample for at least 2 seconds and remove.
Dip the test strip into sample vial and rapidly move back and forth underwater for 15 seconds.
Dip the strip into sample and move back and forth for 30 seconds in sample.
Immerse the reaction zone of the test strip in the pretreated sample (15 – 30 °C) for 1 second
Dry off excess water. (e.g. place it on a towel)
Do not shake excess water from the test strip.
Allow excess liquid to run off via the long edge of the strip onto an absorbent paper towel.
Add 1 drop of reagent K-1 on the reaction zone and allow to react for 1 minute.
Fill the provided bottle with 5 ml of your water sample.
Add 10 drops of the NH4-1 Reagent to the sample.
Swirl the sample to mix the reagent.
Dip the test strip into the sample for 5 seconds and remove.
Shake excess water from the test strip.
Place the test strip with the patch facing left on the black area of the Colour Reference Card and press Start.

Place a clean test strip below the used test strip so that patch has a white background. Place the stacked strips with the patch facing left on the black area of the Colour Reference Card and press Start.
Add 5 drops of the PO4-1 Reagent to the sample.
Place smaller container in the provided rack.
Add 6 drops of the PO4-2 Reagent to the smaller container.
Dip the test strip into the sample for 15 seconds and remove.
Dip the test strip into the smaller tube for 15 seconds and remove.
Dip the test strip into the sample for 1 second and remove.
Insert a test strip into the cap so the pad completely covers the small opening. Close the flap and press to secure.
Fill the reaction bottle with sample to the fill line (50 mL).

Add one Reagent #1 and one Reagent #2 powder pillow to the sample. If a rotten egg smell is detected after adding reagent #1, sulfide is present at interfering levels, [a topic=sulfide]click here[/a] to see how to remove sulfide before continuing the test procedure.
Immediately attach the cap to the reaction bottle. Swirl continuously for 60 seconds. Do not shake or invert or allow sample to get on the strip.
Wait 20 minutes. Swirl twice during the reaction period.
Remove the test strip and immediately from the cap and place the test strip facing left on the Colour Reference Card and press Start.
Fill the square measuring vial to the top with sample (9.6 mL). Pour the sample into the reaction bottle.

DANGER: Hydrogen and arsine gases are generated during the test. Work in a well-ventilated area away from open flames and other sources of ignition. Review Material Safety Data Sheets for safe handling, storage and disposal information.
Dip the strip into 250+ ml sample and move back and forth for 60 seconds in sample.
Shake once the excess water from test strip.
Complete the following steps to remove the sulfide before beginning the test procedure:
Tear off a small piece of cotton and form a ball the size of a pea.
Saturate the cotton with a few drops of lead acetate. Squeeze excess liquid out of the cotton, leaving it damp.

Press the saturated cotton ball into the small opening of the reaction bottle cap from the bottom. Be sure that the cotton is firmly in place and that a gap remains between the cotton and the top surface of the cap.
Insert the test strip as detailed in step 1 of the 0–500 or 0–4000 ppb test procedure and continue with the test.
Note: The lead acetate must not contact the test strip!
Always wear gloves or wash hands thoroughly after handling lead acetate.
Collect Mehlich extraction sample
Collect 5 ml Mehlich extraction sample using the provided bottle.
Collect water extraction sample
Add 5 drops of reagent 1 to the sample
Swirl the sample to mix the reagent
In the smaller container tube put 6 drops of reagent 2
Dip the strip for 15 seconds in the small tube containing reagent 2.
Place the tube in the provided rack.
Dip a strip into sample for 15 seconds and remove.
Shake excess water from test strip.
